cs.IR, cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.CV. 

The paper is about improving the performance of neural ranking models in the ad-hoc retrieval task by taking advantage of multiple document fields. This task is typically studied in the information retrieval (IR) community, which falls under the cs.IR sub-category. The paper also discusses techniques such as masking and dropout, which are commonly used in natural language processing (NLP) and machine learning (ML) research, falling under the cs.CL and cs.LG sub-categories. Additionally, the paper uses deep neural networks, which are a popular tool in artificial intelligence (AI) research, falling under the cs.AI sub-category. Finally, the paper mentions the use of image data in some experiments, which could relate to computer vision (CV) research, falling under the cs.CV sub-category.
